name: Random Friend
desc:
Lore

"Marco? Who is that guy? I guess he is my friend for now…"

Card Mechanic

4 HP. Roll D20. On 1-2 Cancel Opponent's Card. Defensive Summon.

name: Beautiful Distraction
desc:
Lore

Is it female? Male? Does it matter?

Card Mechanic

1 HP. Opponent's hit chance drops to 40% as long as this card is in play. Non-stackable. Defensive Summon.

name: Cute Dog
desc:
Lore

,

"Awwwwwwwww......"

Card Mechanic

2 HP. Roll D20. On 1-7, Cancel Opponents Move. Offensive Summon

name: Another You
shortDesc: Your opponent has a chance of not damaging you. Sacrifice: Draw 3 Cards
desc:
Lore

"The person I love the most is myself"

Instant use device creates a holographic mirror image of the user.

Card Mechanic

2 HP. Everytime it Is hit roll 1D100 if 50 or above, no damage is taken. Sacrifice Card: Draw 3 cards. Defensive Summon

name: Columbus Spencer
desc:
Lore

Columbus is a Kingdom of Frog outcast. Black Ops. He operates in the shadows of the honorable frog Empire. He is part of a covert group of Frogs sent to perform things the Kingdom of Frog deems degenerate.

Personally Columbus is a degenerate frog, unable to fit into the Frog society. He operates from the darkest parts of the known universe.

He loves human alcohol and drugs. He is a sharpshooter and his special Type-T revolver is augmented by Libeteriani technology and is uniquely capable of firing a charged stream of immutable bullets in one go, terribly accurate and devastating.

Card Mechanic

7 HP, 40% chance of attacking each turn, 80% hit chance, if hit does 1D12 Damage. Offensive Summon

name: Spice Queen
shortDesc: Chance of converting opponent's summon to yours.
desc:
Lore

The Spice Queen was a former human. She was unable to deal with the fact that the humans killed off most men during the Moon War.

After she discovered how many men there are in the cryptocurrency space. She voluntarily went into "the merging" with the blockchain. Kind and caring. She enjoys a great deal of popularity with the Insane Ones.

Within the blockchain she discovered a grander purpose… to convince more humans to voluntarily fuse with the blockchain. Using the blockchain, her powers are to incept ideas into other people's minds.

Card Mechanic

5 HP, Every turn roll 1D6, if you get 1 or 2, opponent summon changes ownership to you. Defensive Summon.

name: Gym Friend Collin
desc:
Lore

One of the last original men from humanity. Collin was a perfect male specimen that the females have kept in a capsule for their “entertainment”. He is forever enclosed inside a capsule to keep the females safe, though occasionally he gets let out for females to have fun. This is rare.

Collin spends most of his time talking to females through his headset. Mostly he is kept alive to keep a “memory” of the fact that males once existed.

As a original man, Collin also retains much knowledge from before the male extinction. This means he has highly entertaining stories of what life was like before men were exterminated by women.

Card Mechanic

5 HP, Attacks every turn (1D6) (80% hit Chance) Sacrifice: Does 1D12 attack

name: Male Creature
desc:
Lore

Whilst most of the men died in the Last Man Standing war of humanity. Humanity has kept males around as pets. These “male creatures” serve nothing more than being foot rests for the females, they are sent on the battlefield to divert attention and are expected to die.

Should the male creature disobey, the choker around their necks will explode.

This never happens though as the male creature has been systematically bred to be unable to have much individualistic thought, other than the forever craving and subservience to their female masters.

Card Mechanic

7 HP, does not attack. Defensive Summon.

name: Frog Apprentice
desc:
Lore

A young frog in training. A aspiring frog warrior must survive many trials in combat under the guidance of the frog warrior before finally gaining the title of frog warrior.

Frog apprentices dress in light armor to give them quick speed, whilst less armored than Frog warriors, they make up for their lack of armor by being nimble and move much faster.

Combined with Frog Energy Field technology, they are often underestimated in the battlefield.

Card Mechanic

3 HP, Attacks every turn at 1D4 (80% hit chance), ignores any defence or armour. Offensive Summon.

name: Frog Plate
shortDesc: Reduces damage significantly. Can be broken.
desc:
Lore

The full frog plate is armor bestowed by the Kingdom of Frog on those who become Frog Warriors. It is an ornate piece of high tech engineering that takes a year for Frog forge masters to create. Each piece of frog plate is capable of projecting a full frog energy field (FEF). These fields are not only defensive, and can be used offensive to slice and batter enemies.

Unlike human forcefield technology, FEF can be activated for long periods of time and will only shut after they are overloaded. The imposing frog plate covers an already formidable muscular foe.

The plate armor adds considerable weight to a Frog, making them less nimble, but far more destructive and well protected. Frog plate uses a unknown alloy that has been unable to be reversed engineered by human technology. Combined with FEF technology, the plate armor can only be penetrated with the most powerful weaponry, or sustained fire from multiple opponents.

Card Mechanic

6 Armor Tokens, 80% chance of reducing damage by 6 if Hit

name: Frog Chainmail
desc:
Lore

Often worn by budding Frog Warriors who cannot wear full Frog Plate. It is annoying to equip, but provides good protection in battle.

Card Mechanic

80% chance of reduce damage by 4.

name: Energy Whip
desc:
Lore

Standard issue Athenian power whip, cauterizes anything it touches, fast moving melee weapon that hurts.

Card Mechanics

Attacks for 1D6 (default damage) + 4 damage.

name: Blade
desc:
Lore

Standard issue Frog sword. Engineered by their advanced material scientists. It is extremely light, making it deadly fast.

Card Mechanic

1D6 + bonus damage of 2, if hit roll D100, if over 40, roll 1D8 for damage again

name: Revolver
shortDesc: Hits hard. Can deal significant damage.
desc:
Lore

Standard Frog revolver.

bullets are armor piercing and shielded in FFT (Frog Forcefield Technology).

Ammunition on the Frog Revolver is limited, but each shot is extremely powerful and penetrates most Human armor and hurts Liberterianis even if they are phased into the blockchain.

Card Mechanic

9HP. 6 Ammo tokens (uses). 1D6 + 1D12.

name: Battle Rifle
shortDesc: 4 Bursts of fire. Hit multiple targets.
desc:
Lore

Powerful assault rifle used by Athenian marines. Capable of full-auto, but mostly used in smart burst fire mode. It uses case-less ammunition.

The gun is excellent for taking out lots of weaker targets at medium range. A skilled user can time program the burst timing to hit multiple targets at once.

It comes default with a standard issue hybrid scope, but the scope can be changed depending on scenario. It is a extremely versatile weapon liked by all 3 races.

Card Mechanic

5 Ammo tokens (uses). 4 X 1D6 (each with 80% hit chance). Excellent choice for clearing summons.

name: Power Armor
shortDesc: Reduces damage, also makes you strong. Can be broken.
desc:
Lore

Earth technology developed after the elimination of males. As the human race spread to the stars they needed advanced mechanical augmentation for severe environments in space, leading to the development of power armor.

As the humans discovered The Sphere and the other races, their military force required a substantial upgrade to personnel and that resulted in turning power armor into combat usage.

Covered in thick Neo-Steel plating, and enhanced by advanced beam diffusion ceramics the power armor also fully augments strength and carrying capacity of humans. It is particularly good with protecting against heavy weapons fire.

Card Mechanic

All damage deal bonus D6, 80% chance of reducing damage by 4 (if hit). 4 Armour tokens.

name: Combat Weave
desc:
Lore

Advanced composite bullet proof vest. Preferred by users who like some resistance to damage, but still can move freely.

Card Mechanic

90% reduce damage by 2.

name: Halberd
shortDesc: Hard to swing, but if it hits it can hurt ALOT.
desc:
Lore

Heavy weapon used by Kingdom of Frog. Enhanced with Frog Energy Field.

Card Mechanic

Reduce hit chance to 70%, 1D20 damage.

name: Antigrav Boots
shortDesc: Synergistic with Leap: Certain hit. Sacrifice: Evasion boost.
desc:
Lore

Allows users to fly for a while.

Card Mechanic

When leap is played, reduce hit chance to 20. Sacrifice Card: Reduce hit chance to 40%.

name: Neosteel Helmet
desc:
Lore

Used in space when Athenians need to be sealed completely. Neosteel is the strongest plating the Athenians can currently manufacture.

Card Mechanic

80% chance of damage reduction by 2, no armour tokens (infinite uses).

name: Heads Up Display
desc:
Lore

Used often by Athenian pilots, this headset adds powerful sensors, giving Athenians ability to see in the dark, identify targets further out, and important environmental data.

Card Mechanic

Increase hit chance to 90%.

name: Sunglasses
shortDesc: You're so cool. You can just ignore defensive summons.
desc:
Lore

You need lore for this?

Card Mechanic

Player can target other player directly even if there are defensive summons in play.

name: Bionic Upgrades
shortDesc: Augments your damage. Instantly heal your armour.
desc:
Lore

The standard implant package issued to female space faring personnel includes light bone reinforcement, improved recovery, standard brain computer interface and standard nerve impulse enhancement. This light package is widely adopted because it does not involve severe augmentation of the human body.

Card Mechanic

Adds extra 2 damage to all default damage. If Bionic Upgrades is equiped instantly adds 3 armor tokens

name: ZEAL Special Forces Suit
shortDesc: Reduces damage slightly. Sacrifice: Stealth ability.
desc:
Lore

Worn by the most elite assassins of the Athenian Federation. The special forces suit is bulletproof and can activate thermo optic camouflage, it also boasts a array of combat theater electronics and sensors.

The ZEAL suit also greatly augment the fine movement of the assassins, steadying their aim and making their movements more precise.

Finally, the ZEAL suit also comes with a electronic stun function located on the palm area.

Card Mechanic

80% chance of reducing damage by 2. Sacrifice Card: Opponent attack is negated, after all is resolved make a normal attack.

name: Flashstep Boots
shortDesc: Draw a card, when you're defending.
desc:
Lore

Short burst boosters allow users to move faster in combat.

Card Mechanic

When defending, and it's successful draw an extra card.

name: Bulletproof Pants
desc:
Lore

Standard Athenian Federation issue. Comfortable but offers good protection against light firearms and melee weapons.

Card Mechanic

No armour tokens. Reduce damage by 1 as long as in play.

name: Reinforced Bones
desc:
Lore

Surgically grafted armor unto the otherwise fragile human body. Whilst it does not reduce pain, it prevents them from breaking and shield much impact.

The bone plating themselves are made of Terran Neo-steel a type of strong allow developed by the Atheniansb

It is also incredibly light and a good choice for humans who do not want to be encumbered by heavy armor and value mobility.

Card Mechanic

All damage reduced by 2

name: Synaptic Accelerator
desc:
Lore

Though brain augmentations are not popular in the Athenian Federation, due to paranoia of surveillance and loss of control. The secretive MC5 organization has created a limited number of these chips, that when implants greatly improves dexterity, reflexes and focus.

The chip directly monitors motor skills and supercharges brain impulse speeds. MC5 technology is so advanced even Frogs and Libertarianis do not fully understand how they work.

The MC5 organization was key in the civil war in humans between female and men, and contributed greatly to the females winning the war. The level of biological augmentation in MC5 technology is far greater than most standard Athenian technology.

Card Mechanic

Allows playing two combat action cards together in a single turn. Card is currently non-functional in-game.

name: Sword of Pepe
desc:
Lore

The legendary sword wielded by Pepe the 1st. Forged with technologically enhanced special metal only made on the Frog Homeworld. This sword has survived nightmares with Pepe.

The sword has a ORB powered forcefield crystal, that projects a powerful Frog Energy Field. A type of forcefield that can be reshaped by the will of the wielder.

Communicating telepathically with its users. The sword can project a defensive shield that protects its users, or it can be reshaped into a energy field surrounding the blade that enhances its striking and cutting power.

Card Mechanic

Hit chance reduces to 70%, if hit roll 3D12. Cannot use for 1 turn after putting into play.

name: Love Chain of Athena
shortDesc: Always causes opponent pain. Sometimes draw cards.
desc:
Lore

Athena Minerva Clyde’s personal weapon. Enhanced part by part through decades of war. It is a prehensile mechanical whip, that can commanded by a brain-computer interface move around independent of the user.

It bristles with blades enhanced with energy tips. It can automatically wrap around the user as a parry maneuver, as lightning fast as it can jab and hurt enemies painfully.

Originally a gift from her husband before the moon wars. Ever since, she has had the best Athenian scientists work on it after every battle.

Card Mechanic

Hit chance improves to 90%. 1D12 Damage, Everytime Love Chain hits draw 3 Cards

name: Spice Cannon
shortDesc: Obliterate your opponent in one shot.
desc:
Lore

Sphere Builder Technology. Uses a special kind of scarce bio-fuel only found on Illium-3 (The Sphere) also just known as Spice. Functional Sphere Builder weaponry is very rare.

A weapon with more firepower than sense. The Spice Cannon’s beam fire slices through kilometers of neosteel without resistance, but who was it designed to be used against?

Or what was it designed to kill…?

Card Mechanic

2 Ammo Tokens. 90% hit chance damage is 3D20

name: Grenade
desc:
Lore

Standard Athenian Federation issue. The powerful grenade has a wide blast radius and has good chance of hitting everything where it is thrown.

Card Mechanic

Multiply your standard damage and chance of inflicting on all units including summons. Use this item if overwhelmed by summons.

name: Medkit
desc:
Lore

Standard medkit is designed by humans but easily compatible with any normal biological beings. It has fully functionality in restoring wounds to any organ. Very useful. h4> Card Mechanic Gain 3xD8 Health

name: Focused Strike
shortDesc: Double your damage, but more likely to miss.
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

Double damage, but reduces hit chance by 20%.

name: Feign
shortDesc: If your opponent misses you gain willpower.
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

If your opponent misses you gain 6D2 will.

name: Evade
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

Reduce opponent's hit chance by 40%, draw 2 cards.

name: Double Tap
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

Double attack damage if hit.

name: Trick Shot
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

If shot misses, roll for another hit again.

name: Mind Games
desc:
Lore

Play 4D chess.

Card Mechanic

70% chance, player misses next turn completely.

name: Electrical Field
desc:
Lore

Athenian technology. It activates a powerful electrical field around the user that increases the effectiveness of any melee attack by supercharging it with electrical energy, other people who come close to the user will also be electrocuted.

Card Mechanic

If attacking with melee adds 1D6 damage, lasts 4 turns after playing.

name: Aimbot
desc:
Lore

Automated head targeting aided by cybernetics. Makes you a good shot even if you are not.

Card Mechanic

100% hit chance instantly.

name: Poker Face
shortDesc: Hide the truth about how weak you are.
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

Poker: Your face does not change, no matter what happens for the rest of the game.

name: Fancy Moves
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

Your opponent is forced to use defend, no matter what he chooses.

name: Combat Roll
shortDesc: Roll around and hope you get hit less.
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed.

Card Mechanic

Reduce hit chance to 40%, draw 2 cards.

name: Reckless Charge
shortDesc: Charge in, you might be hurt, but you might hurt more.
desc:
Lore

FUUUCKKK THIIIIS!

Card Mechanic

Roll D8 , if 4 or above, take damage from enemy wep. Attack again with 40% hit.

name: Taunt
desc:
Lore

No explanation needed. You’re shout something to the other person.

Card Mechanic

Gain 3 will instantly.

name: All In
shortDesc: Double everything. Who has the bigger gun?
desc:
Lore

"I don't give a fuck anymore. Do YOU?"

Card Mechanics

Everyone does double damage this round.

name: Hide Behind Something
desc: For the next six turns net reduce hit chance to 30%, cannot attack.

name: Stim Pack
shortDesc: Attack twice, but you lose health.
desc:
Lore

Athenian Federation. Designed to enhance battle performance, at a cost later. Bad withdrawals.

Card Mechanic

Attack twice. Lose 5 + 1D4 Health.

name: Pain Killers
shortDesc: Gain some health, but it doesn't last long.
desc:
Lore

The drugs that keep you alive, for a while.

Card Mechanic

Gain 2D6 health, but only lasts for 4 turns.

name: Blow a Kiss
shortDesc: Your opponent can't come near you.
desc:
Lore

Especially bad if the kiss doesn’t come from your preferred sex.

Card Mechanic

Opponent melee attacks are completely negated for 7 turns.

name: Move Fast
desc:
Lore

No explanation.

Card Mechanic

Roll d12, if 8 or above, cancel opponent attack card.

name: Misdirection
shortDesc: Chance of reducing opponent hit chance.
desc:
Lore

No explanation.

Card Mechanic

Roll D8, if roll above 6 enemy hit chance reduced to 50%, runs for 6 turns.

name: Instant Roids
shortDesc: Become a tank for a while.
desc:
Lore

During the elimination of the male gender from the human species, the females realized they had one issue when it came to sheer brute strength in combat, that they were not naturally as muscular as males.

To overcome this issue, female scientists developed a kind of anabolic steroid that worked to enhance and grow muscles in an extremely short period of time.

This allow combat females to quickly gain massive muscle enhancement in the span of 24 hours. Whilst this innovation has little side effect, the downside is the muscles also degrade and return to normal very quickly.

Card Mechanic

Reduce damage by 10, last for 4 turns.

name: Headshot
desc:
Lore

Next time…aim for the head.

Card Mechanic

If weapon hits, roll another 1D6 , if it is 3 or above, it does extra 1D8 damage.

name: Leap
shortDesc: Jump for it. It's time for melee weapons.
desc:
Lore

Jump really high! It works wonders when you also happen to be carrying a sharp weapon.

Card Mechanic

Reduce opponent hit chance to 60%, double melee damage dealt.

name: Smoke Grenade
desc:
Lore

Standard Athenian Smoke grenade. Effective to make your enemy lose sight on you.

Card Mechanic

Makes opponent attack hit chance 30% for this turn.

name: Rekt
shortDesc: Opponent is incapiticated by your screaming
desc:
Lore

REEEEEEEEEE Opponenet is incapacitated by your screaming

Card Mechanic

Turn is cancelled and opponent takes 1D6 damage (100% hit chance).

name: Reorg
shortDesc: Disarm the latest gadget equiped by your opponent.
desc:
Lore

Dematerialize the latest gadget your opponent has just equipped via a blockchain attack.

Card Mechanic

Remove most recent equipment equiped from enemy and discard it.

name: White Paper
desc:
Lore

All technical people worship this essay usually produced by a highly intelligent or in bad cases, a devious person seeking to enrich themselves, but sometimes the white papers has ideas which hold the key to advancing technology.

Card Mechanic

Gain 1 will every turn.

name: Bitcoin Jesus Roger Ver
shortDesc: Chance of resurrection. Immune to ranged weapons.
desc:
Lore

One of the earliest investors in Bitcoin. As his wealth increased to join the tech super-rich of the 21st century he later came to be known as Bitcoin Jesus. Bitcoin Jesus led his libertarian followers to transcend reality and become one with decentralized programmable money, in a process now referred to as The Merging.

Others soon followed into The Merging from other cryptocurrency utopia believers and thus the Libertarian Consensus was formed.The process however was far from perfect and left all his followers half in reality and half permanently fused to The Blockchain.

With a business empire spanning hundreds of star systems. His obsession with true peer to peer electronic cash has driven some outsiders to believe he has gone insane, but nobody knows if he is insane or truly onto something…

Card Mechanic

5 HP. If killed there is a 70% chance of card reviving to 5HP. Immune to ranged weapons. Attacks every turn (1D6).

name: Sock Puppets
shortDesc: If hit. Opponents miss a turn.
desc:
Lore

Liberteriani often employ create fake personas to embellish the size of their cyber empire.

Card Mechanic

4HP. If hit, 10% chance of opponent losing their turn.

name: Immutability
desc:
Lore

A libertarian is able to survive critical damage by making himself or herself “immutable” for a short time by fusing more with the blockchain. Other races sometimes can use this libertarian technology to escape certain death.

Card Mechanic

Revive's the player to 10HP, but only when player is already in critical state (0HP).

name: Consensus
desc:
Lore

The "consensus" has decided that without you.

Card Mechanics

Opponent's summons cannot attack for the next 7 turns.

name: Hard Fork
desc:
Lore

In a pure stroke of anger. A Liberteriani developer can “disagree with reality” and attempt to fork it.

By splitting the blockchain the Libertarian is currently in. The user can for a few seconds create a dangerous arc of disagreeable code.

The fork materializes as pure energy from which the blockchain has forked. It is destructive and burns anyone in the way.

Card Mechanic

Deal 3D4 to Any Target. Player does not attack with weapon on their turn

name: Athena M. Clyde
shortDesc: Always causes paralyzing pain. On hit, draw cards.
desc:
Lore

Betrayed by her former lover who killed her only child. She eventually weaponised all her knowledge of the moon base where she lived with the last free males of the collapsing Solar Alliance.

In the final moon battle where she served as commander in chief. Athena ordered the obliteration of the moon, killing the last hiding males of the human race.

Since then she has discovered a taste for battle and can only find peace in causing pain.

Card Mechanic

5HP Athena attacks first before anything else. If she hits it cancel's opponent's attack. Hits every turn (1D6).

name: Pepe the 1st
desc:
Lore

Pepe was the first Frog to discover and exit The Sphere. He was a top ranking explorer warrior who was part of a expedition team to chart unknown planet, where his vessel encountered Illium-3 (The Sphere).

The expedition team successfully entered The Sphere, but only Pepe returned alive, thus making him the first character in known history to have exited The Sphere via The Tower. He returned to the Frog Homeworld with the first ORB and became a legend in the Kingdom of Frog.

His battle prowess was already legendary before entering The Sphere, however Pepe refuses to disclose exactly what happened to the rest of the expedition team, all The Kingdom of Frog knows is whatever happened, it changed and scarred Pepe mentally forever.

Card Mechanic

9HP. As long as Pepe is in Play, the player is invincible. Hits every turn (2D4).

name: Personal Forcefield
shortDesc: If lucky you can negate all damage, or some.
desc:
Lore

Humans have not mastered forcefield technology, unlike the Kingdom of Frog they do not have passive forcefields that are always on, in their ships and personnel. Human scientists have developed techniques allowing for a forcefield to be projected a very short time using fusion power cells.

The forcefield belt is a miniatures version of human forcefield technology. Whilst after turning the forcefield on the user is only protected for a short time.

Human forcefields expend a lot of energy in a short time causing the user to be rendered almost invulnerable for a short period of time to most weapon attacks.

Card Mechanic

Roll 1D6 if under 3, reduce damage by half, if over 3, reduce all.

name: Tackle
shortDesc: Hit low and drag opponent down to a brawl.
desc:
Lore

Hit low and hopefully drag opponent down to a brawl for some time.

Card Mechanic

Roll D100, if above 30, both use fist attack with 1D6
